topic.title: Does this remind you of any politicians?
Need help pinning a thread on my own forum.
topic.body: I am trying to make my own online forum using a clone of zerotalk. I need help pinning the "rules" thread to the top of the forum irregardless of new content. I have the certificate for the zsite that I am trying to pin this thread on. Please help!

topic.title: If a bitmessage API were built into ZeroNet, and ZeroMail, would you use it.
topic.body: If so, do you trust bitmessage? It would proxy into the same tor tunnel as ZeroNet.

1602257402_1abBjBW8axFAtcZN11jv527Wi2noB.body: Dude, there is no new world order. The Alex Jones types have had it right around the corner for almost a decade. Besides, there are more pressing issues.

1604109014_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: Well, Biden passed multiple crime bills, supported the invasion of Iraq and Afghanistan even before 9/11, stated many racist quotes, and allegedly groped an intern. Trump is the lesser of the two evils, even though I agree that both candidates are terrible options. The libertarian nominee is not much better either though.

1605258725_1EQvG7tmmrK7rvVPaXm9zFeHckdhP.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_2684_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You don't need a page open. ZeroNet always runs. You must be used to the steaming pile of shit that is the Beaker Browser.

But what happens when you turn your computer off. I think he is trying to create a server that runs 24/7 irregardless of the status of his main machine. I would use at least a Raspberry Pi 3 A+ though.

1605282602_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [kapec](#comment_77_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): It would be silly to even try stopping progress.But we can at least mitigate its exploitative potential by making sure such projects stay open source, by making open datasets and by fighting computer illiteracy in general public. [...]

How do you know, If a computer can demonstrate humanity even when you know they are a computer, then they are human and should be granted equal rights to prevent a robot uprising. GPT-3 is incredibly close to being human. It can string words together like a human, but as far as I know, it cannot feel or desire. I believe, that with enough computing power and data, a computer can become human. I believe that there is nothing stopping a computer from feeling and wanting but computing power itself.

1603374060_1E1y7xgzGJZzFvxUsjsXWk3YnBoGG.body: Thank you, I will try it out.
After trying out Tribbler, I have switched from qBittorrent to Tribbler.

1605294278_1KNkHfHESMzY6Lg7wCVkMzY5a4Ren.body:
> [jizzontits](#comment_4_1KNkHfHESMzY6Lg7wCVkMzY5a4RenNw9kC): Nothing as good as youtube and nothing that monetises for the uploaders.

I propose that the site be purely a content aggregator. Tubers would self host their videos via IPFS, or pay someone else to. Advertisements could be paid for in a manner similar to the Basic Attention Token. For the interface, look to Bitchute for inspiration. All tubers would vote for a moderator, the top 35 winners would be made moderator for that specific topic. The rules for each topic would be created by the mods and approved by referendum. New topics could be created by decentralized petition.

> [mg0](#comment_385_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): a centralized youtube works, the issue is when politics make laws that law enforcement agencies use as excuses to force people in charge of centralized platforms to discriminate content because reasons. A centralized youtube works well since a single company can handle the HUGE amount of storage needed for that, but since countries can prohibit it or worse if they don't ban certain stuff... in the case of zeronet, if the people wake up and become a bit more tech savvy (so they can use it above the fact that CP and other stuff lurks around) then we would only have to deal with the limited storage capacity. Now, it would be interesting if some people can set some 24/7 on nodes seeding some sites, and said sites are configured to seed a certain amount (and certain files) on every node so the files are scattered and the availability of the site doesn't depend on how popular some files are.

I propose each tuber self host, or pay someone else to.
